p: RK-33 is a REN with anticancer properties [ 11, 13, 14, 15, 16] speculated to target the ATP binding site of DDX3X [ 11]. Since DDX3X plays a role in the replication of various viruses [ 5, 6, 7, 8], we set out here for the first time to confirm RK-33â€²s ability to bind directly to DDX3X, inhibit its enzymatic activities, and test its ability to inhibit a range of viral infections.
